data.text:
In Headline News: Another promising company was sentenced to death late last month for being too good at what IBM said it was already good at -- as IBM acquired FinOps provider Apptio.

Congratulations to the folks at Vista for the excellent value creation work, selling for $4.6 Billion a company they purchased for $1.94 Billion in 2019. Not bad considering 3.5 of those years were impacted by a global pandemic. The deal was just finalized earlier this month.

https://www.pehub.com/vista-wraps-up-4-6bn-sale-of-apptio-to-ibm/

Condolences to the folks at Apptio. Be prepared for the onslaught of destruction from runaway bride-eyed middle managers who insist that you must now blue-wash your contracts, slash your R&D budgets, fire all your top innovative (expensive) people, and construct report after report communicating nonsense on top of nonsense for layer beyond layer of middle management oversight. Oh yeah, also, sorry to tell you, but you're a financial company now, no longer a tech company.

So sorry also for any actual customers out there who used to like working with Apptio as your life is also about to change as well (and not for the better).

Just out of morbid curiosity, how many people today are using:

i2

FileNet

Cognos

SoftLayer

Greenplum

Lotus Software

Rational Software

Sterling Commerce

The genocidal IBM acquisition team has forged the world's best, most amazing 'kiss of death' cultural integration process ever conceived, let alone conjured, and the mere touch of its gangrenous apparatus is enough to eradicate the hip, vibrant, innovative, forward-thinking, trendsetting, influential, and buzz-worthy.

The avant-garde who believe they are well-established and insulated from this insanity should especially take note because you will be among the first to be targeted for humiliation and destruction.
